page.title: 17Transport continued
page.content: depot in the village and electric powered milk floats are often seen. Coaches carrying some villagers to work and older children to Icknield Comprehensive School at Watlington may be seen. Children from Ewelme School travel by coach to swimming pool at Carmel College every thursday. Farm tractors, animal transporters, trailers and combines all use roads frequently. Gypsies are frequent visitors to Ewelme's lane. Their vans and caravans are appearing mre frequently than they used to do. There is no permanent site for them here so they seem to stay for longer periods than they used to. In the centre of the village it is apparente there is a steady flow of traffic, mainly cars and light vans, through the village all day, busiest time around 5pm.
